    Xuan-Toan Dang

    Phd Student

    I received my Bachelor of Engineering degree in wireless communication engineering from the Hanoi University of Science and Technology, Hanoi City, Vietnam in 2020. In 2023, I received the M.E. degree in electronic engineering from Soongsil University, Seoul, Korea. I am currently pursuing my Ph.D. degree at Soongsil University. My research interests include wireless communications with optimization techniques, machine learning, deep learning for wireless communications, and signal processing for communications.

    • South Korea
    • Soongsil University

    Publications

    • Optimization of RIS-assisted Cell-free Massive MIMO Systems with Heterogeneous Graph Neural Networks under Imperfect Channel Estimation

      Nguyen, Q.-S., Dang, X.-T., & Shin, O.-S. (2025). "Optimization of RIS-assisted Cell-free Massive MIMO Systems with Heterogeneous Graph Neural Networks under Imperfect Channel Estimation." IEEE Transactions on Vehicular Technology.

    • Optimizing Energy Efficiency for Federated Learning in Rotary-Wing UAV Air-to-Ground Communications

      Dang, X.-T., Nguyen, Q.-S., & Shin, O.-S. (2025). "Optimizing Energy Efficiency for Federated Learning in Rotary-Wing UAV Air-to-Ground Communications." IEEE Transactions on Green Communications and Networking.

    • A DDPG-LSTM Framework for Optimizing UAV-Enabled Integrated Sensing and Communication

      Dang, X.-T., Eom, J.-S., Vu, B.-M., & Shin, O.-S. (2025). "A DDPG-LSTM Framework for Optimizing UAV-Enabled Integrated Sensing and Communication." Drones, 9(8), 548.

    • Optimization of Energy Efficiency for Federated Learning over IRS-assisted Cell-free Massive MIMO Networks

      Dang, X.-T., Nguyen, H. V., & Shin, O.-S. (2025). "Optimization of Energy Efficiency for Federated Learning over IRS-assisted Cell-free Massive MIMO Networks." IEEE Transactions on Wireless Communications.

    • Combining the Viterbi Algorithm and Graph Neural Networks for Efficient MIMO Detection

      Nguyen, T. A., Dang, X.-T., Shin, O.-S., & Lee, J. (2025). "Combining the Viterbi Algorithm and Graph Neural Networks for Efficient MIMO Detection." Electronics, 14(9), 1698.

    • A Survey on Energy-Efficient Design for Federated Learning over Wireless Networks

      Dang, X.-T., Vu, B.-M., Nguyen, Q.-S., Tran, T.-T.-M., Eom, J.-S., & Shin, O.-S. (2024). "A Survey on Energy-Efficient Design for Federated Learning over Wireless Networks." Energies, 17(24), 6485.

    • Physical Layer Security for IRS-UAV-Assisted Cell-Free Massive MIMO Systems

      Dang, X.-T., Nguyen, H. V., & Shin, O.-S. (2024). "Physical Layer Security for IRS-UAV-Assisted Cell-Free Massive MIMO Systems." IEEE Access.

    • Optimization of Energy Efficiency for Federated Learning over Unmanned Aerial Vehicle Communication Networks

      Dang, X.-T., & Shin, O.-S. (2024). "Optimization of Energy Efficiency for Federated Learning over Unmanned Aerial Vehicle Communication Networks." Electronics, 13(10), 1827.

    • Optimization of IRS-NOMA-Assisted Cell-Free Massive MIMO Systems Using Deep Reinforcement Learning

      Dang, X.-T., Nguyen, H. V., & Shin, O.-S. (2023). "Optimization of IRS-NOMA-Assisted Cell-Free Massive MIMO Systems Using Deep Reinforcement Learning." IEEE Access.

    • Optimization of Physical Layer Security in IRSs-assisted Cell-Free Massive MIMO Systems

      Dang, X.-T., Shin, O.-S. (2023). "Optimization of Physical Layer Security..." 2023 VTS APWCS.

    • Optimal User Pairing Approach for NOMA-Based Cell-Free Massive MIMO Systems

      Dang, X.-T., Le, M. T. P., Nguyen, H. V., Chatzinotas, S., & Shin, O.-S. (2023). "Optimal User Pairing Approach for NOMA-Based Cell-Free Massive MIMO Systems." IEEE Transactions on Vehicular Technology, 72(4), 4751-4765.

    • Optimal User Pairing for NOMA-assisted Cell-free Massive MIMO System

      Dang, X.-T. et al. (2022). "Optimal User Pairing for NOMA-assisted CFMM." 2022 IEEE Ninth ICCE.

    • A genetic algorithm based pilot assignment strategy for cell-free massive MIMO system

      Dang, X.-T. et al. (2021). "A genetic algorithm based pilot assignment strategy..." 2020 IEEE Eighth ICCE.
